com.paydiant.android.config

Class PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paydiant.android.config.PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo
  • Enclosing class:
    PaydiantApplicationConfig

    public static class PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo
extends Object
    Contains the information required to pin a certificate associated with the Paydiant mobile gateway.
    Since:
    4.4.0.2
    Author:
    Paydiant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String[] authTypes
      The supported key exchange algorithms used with the pinning certificate.
      short chainPosition
      Position of the pinning certificate in the certificate chain.
      byte[] fingerprint
      SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo(String[] authTypes, byte[] fingerprint)
      Creates a X509CertPinInfo instance to pin the server's(subject's) certificate (i.e., chainPosition = 0).
      PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo(String[] authTypes, byte[] fingerprint, short chainPosition)
      Creates a X509CertPinInfo instance to pin with the certificate found in the chainPosition of the certificate chain.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • authTypes

        public String[] authTypes
        The supported key exchange algorithms used with the pinning certificate. (e.g., RSA) Validation of this is case-sensitive.

      • fingerprint

        public byte[] fingerprint
        SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate. This can be calculated from tools/libraries like openssl.
        (e.g., openssl x509 -in <certificate_path> -noout -fingerprint -sha1 -inform [PEM|DER])

      • chainPosition

        public short chainPosition
        Position of the pinning certificate in the certificate chain. Value of 0 indicates the server's(subject's) certificate. Other positive values indicate intermediate certificate(s) or root certificate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo

        public PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo(String[] authTypes,
                                         byte[] fingerprint)
        Creates a X509CertPinInfo instance to pin the server's(subject's) certificate (i.e., chainPosition = 0).
        Parameters:
        authTypes - - The supported key exchange algorithms used with the pinning certificate. (e.g., RSA). Validation of this is case-sensitive.
        fingerprint - - SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate. Refer to fingerprint field for more details.

      • PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo

        public PaydiantApplicationConfig.X509CertPinInfo(String[] authTypes,
                                         byte[] fingerprint,
                                         short chainPosition)
        Creates a X509CertPinInfo instance to pin with the certificate found in the chainPosition of the certificate chain.
        Parameters:
        authTypes - - The supported key exchange algorithms used with the pinning certificate. (e.g., RSA). Validation of this is case-sensitive.
        fingerprint - - SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate. Refer to fingerprint field for more details.
        chainPosition - - Position of the pinning certificate in the certificate chain. Refer to chainPosition field for more details
